ygData.msgSnippet: What version of Heritrix are you running? If anything earlier than 1.10.2, I recommend upgrading: there s a fix to an issue with an included third-party

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] OutOfMemoryError
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=r-G5_DENsROca5d3pyUMvK314O7eM5jPMIzlKpgcPp1C
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

What version of Heritrix are you running? If anything earlier than 
1.10.2, I recommend upgrading: there's a fix to an issue with an 
included third-party library (DNSJava) using an excessive amount of memory.

If you are encountering recurring OOMEs and have the option of using 
Java 1.6/6.0, I recommend using it. It gives more useful stack dumps 
when hitting OOMEs -- sometimes useful -- and if you get to deeper 
analysis has other benefits as well.

Also, as long as your planned heap size can be achieved with a 32bit 
JVM, it is beneficial to use one -- even if you are on a 64bit 
processor/OS. 64bit JVMs require larger heaps to store the same number 
of objects; one estimate I have seen is that you need a 40% larger heap 
with a 64bit JVM than a 32bit JVM.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

mikbrt wrote:
> I was wondering if anyone was getting OutOfMemoryErrors thrown when
> checkpointing.  On my system (8GB memory, 1GB allocated to the heap) I
> have checkpointing running every twenty four hours and it crashed
> after only a few days.  The checkpointing as far as I know is only
> rolling over the logs, not writing the (jdb?) files.  If anyone has
> any ideas that might help, or if you need more information to help me
> please let me know, thanks!
> Mik
